remarks.para: Center or right EIU may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: EIU Instrument Source Selector is verified to be operative, and
EICAS EIU Selector is verified to be operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

placard.para: Install appropriate Placard(s) in accordance with Dispatch Maintenance Procedure. Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the inoperative EIU by opening and collaring the associated P7 panel EIU C or EIU R circuit breaker.
Verify EIU Instrument Source Selector is operative.

On Captain’s source select panel, position EIU source selector to inoperative EIU and observe that Captain’s EFIS displays are blank. Select L on source selector and observe that EFIS displays return to normal. Then select the other operative EIU (C or R) on source selector and observe that EFIS displays are normal. Return selector to AUTO position and observe that EFIS displays remain normal.
Repeat procedure A on First Officer’s source select panel and EFIS displays.

If EIU selectors are positioned to the same source on both pilots’ source selectors, the EICAS advisory message SOURCE SEL EIU will be displayed. Captain’s and First Officer’s instruments must be on separate sources for dispatch. See MEL 34-00-1-1 for dispatch with inoperative EIU auto-select feature.
With AUTO selected on both pilots’ EIU source selectors, check that EICAS advisory message SOURCE SEL EIU is not displayed.
On both pilots’ EIU source selectors, placard selector position corresponding to inoperative EIU (C or R) “INOP.”
Verify EICAS EIU selector is operative.
With both primary and secondary EICAS displays operating, position EICAS EIU selector to the inoperative EIU and observe that EICAS displays are blank.

Position selector to L and observe that EICAS displays return to normal. Then select the other operative EIU (C or R) on selector and observe that EICAS displays are normal. Return selector to AUTO and observe that EICAS display remains normal.
Placard selector position corresponding to inoperative EIU (C or R) “INOP.”

para.emphasis: If EICAS message EIU DISAGREE is displayed while performing this maintenance procedure, dispatch is not allowed.
